contents: German Chancellor Gerhard Schröder said: “After Auschwitz, who could doubt that [evil] exists, and that it manifested itself in the hate-driven genocide carried out by the Nazi regime? However, noting this fact does not permit us to circumvent our responsibility by blaming everything on a demonic Hitler... The Nazi ideology was something that people supported at the time and that they took part in putting into effect. … We will use the powers of government to protect it against the anti-Semitism of those who refuse to learn the lessons of the past.”
